Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Snot \Snot\, v. t. To blow, wipe, or clear, as the nose. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Snot \Snot\, n. [AS. snot; akin to D. snot, LG. snotte, Dan. snot, and to E. snout. See {Snout}.] 1. Mucus secreted in, or discharged from, the nose. [Low] [1913 Webster]
2. A mean, insignificant fellow. [Low] [1913 Webster]
snot n 1: a person regarded as arrogant and annoying [syn: {snob}, {prig}] 2: nasal mucus
